TopicTitle: What's your favorite place to visit in KSP?

Articles.Content: When I say visit, I mean orbit. It's a little hard to land on Jool/Kerbol.

I love Jool. Looking at from LKO with Distant Object Enhancement, it looks so enticing, and the fact that there are plenty of diverse places to visit make it seem less barren and desolate (I'm looking at you, Dres).

I wuv Duna...

I tend to think its the other 'real' atmosphere planet; because Eve is a pain in the bum to do anything on, and Laythe is very similar to Kerbin with less land...

Duna also feels wildly different to Kerbin, but not really hard/annoying to land on (like Eve), and the fact it has an atmosphere (fun for planes and aerobraking) + low gravity (easier landings and fun EVA jet packs) makes it even funner for me!
I like to look at Jool in the sky from Laythe surface

This polls is a travesty and a sham!

The correct answer, Vall, is not even an option!
Space, does Space Count?
I like Minmus. It's near Kerbin, its gravity is low (but not Gilly-low) and the Great Flats are a great place to land a base.
Definitely Vall. How could people vote Dres? I've orbited there once and vowed never to go back. It's so boring and desolate.
I think that Dres should have a small moon to land on, perhaps a little smaller than gilly.
Eve is my favorite planet to visit, but I don't stay long. I'm usually just there for the gravity assist, but it looks lovely from orbit.

Good poll, I had a hard time making my mind up. There are still some planets I've never even got a transfer-window to because I tend to restart my games a lot. I seem to have most fun going to Moho and I've got a soft-spot for Duna/Ike because it was my first interplanetary landing. Then again, Jool's moons just make it so interesting ... so in the end I voted for Kerbin because there's so much you can do so quickly.

I am always a little tempted to vote for the underdog, but Sun orbit, except low orbit where it gets huge, is just too empty; Moho I've been once and didn't like it there, it feels a bit like a hot slightly larger Mun that is waay to much trouble to get to, but even more so return from; Dres I probably like a bit more than the average player, but not enough to vote for.

And now we get to the positive side of this post. I feel that for me there is no real other option than to vote for Jool. That vote is actually made easier because it contains about a third of the celestial bodies in the game, so the awesomeness that pervades Kerbin system is more concetrated there.
So far i havent even get out of Kerbin system.... but i love it :XD:

This polls is a travesty and a sham!

Picture on Vall 1.

Picture on Vall 2.

The correct answer, Vall, is not even an option!

Hey! That's my favourite!

I consider Mun as my favorite destination, It's not very time consuming and can still be moderately challenging and fun. So if I had a while (this is the hardest part of the challenge) to play KSP, mun mission is a prefect choice.
I usually spend mny days around kerbol, staring at it from 100 KM orbit. (YAY for hyperedit) And EVA my kerbals out doing high fives an spining off into infinity. Greatest stuff i know.

I consider Mun as my favorite destination, It's not very time consuming and can still be moderately challenging and fun. So if I had a while (this is the hardest part of the challenge) to play KSP, mun mission is a prefect choice.

I agree, Mun is still a great place to go (and is time efficient!). I love all the destinations, but Mun is where I go the most, either for a quick mission or for testing landers. It also has more to see (in terms of anomalies and biomes) and I really like its pole regions.
There's just so much to do at Jool and it's moons. Airships on Jool, speedboating on Laythe, etc, etc, just so much. It's seems like a fun place.
Either the Mun or Minimus, I cant do a interplanetary mission to save my life
Oh goodness. The waits in low Gilly orbit and descent towards it were a pain enough.
Duna...mostly because I am terrible at exploring Jool. I can get there easily, but its alway a one way trip.

I think Minmus is my favourite at the moment, because:

1. Its inside Kerbin's sphere of influence and therefore pretty easy to get to (although its orbit and small size can be a bit of a pain)

2. Although the low gravity makes an encounter a bit harder than the Mun, that low gravity also makes it easier to work with once you're there. Don't need so much fuel/rocket power to do stuff

3. Easier to land on than most other moons/planets because it has those big frozen lakes (which look awesome with the EVE mod too)

4. IMO its a more interesting place to visit than the Mun because it just looks cooler
I prefer Eeloo, (I know strange!) because of its difficulty to get to. I would NEVER send less than one kerbal to Eeloo because of loneliness.

I have landed on almost every planet, Duna, Dres, Eve, moons, etc... But...

My favorite place to land has always been actually the Roof of the VAB.

When I say visit, I mean orbit. It's a little hard to land on Jool/Kerbol.

I've put plenty of things into Kerbol orbit... didn't MEAN to put them there, but I did.

So I guess that means Kerbol is my favourite?
